campaign.title: Local SEO in 2025
campaign.subject: Local SEO isn't dead—it evolved. Here's what works now.
campaign.description: What still works in local SEO and what's changed

slides.title: SEO Evolved

content.headline: Local SEO Isn't Dead—It Evolved
content.subhead: What works now is different from what worked before

slides.narration: You've heard the rumors: SEO is dead. Google doesn't matter anymore. Here's the truth: local SEO isn't dead—it evolved. What works now is different from what worked five years ago. Let me show you what actually matters today.

slides.title: What Changed

content.headline: The Old Rules vs. The New Rules

slides.narration: What changed? Old rules: keyword stuffing, link building schemes, gaming the algorithm, everything focused on your website. New rules: natural language content, genuine reputation signals from real customers, presence across multiple platforms, and entity-based optimization where Google understands your business as a real thing, not just a website.

slides.title: What Still Works

content.headline: Local SEO Fundamentals That Still Matter

fundamentals.action: Fast, easy to use on phones

slides.narration: What still works? Google Business Profile—more important than ever. Complete it, keep it accurate, stay active. NAP consistency—your name, address, and phone should be identical everywhere. Reviews—Google weighs them heavily. Volume, velocity, and quality all matter. Local content—content about your area signals relevance. Mobile experience—non-negotiable. If your site is slow or hard to use on phones, you lose.

slides.title: The Entity Factor

content.headline: Google Wants to Know You're Real
content.key_point: Google builds a 'knowledge graph' about your business

slides.narration: Here's what most people miss: Google now thinks in entities, not just keywords. Google wants to know you're a real, legitimate business. It looks for consistent info across platforms—proving you exist. Mentions in authoritative sources—news, directories, citations. Social proof—reviews, engagement, followers. Activity signals—recent posts, events, updates. Google builds a knowledge graph about your business. The more signals, the more confident Google is in recommending you.

slides.title: The AI Connection

content.headline: Local SEO + AI Discovery = Maximum Visibility
content.connection: The same signals that help Google also help AI assistants

slides.narration: Here's the connection most people miss: local SEO and AI discovery aren't separate strategies. They're the same strategy. Multi-platform presence helps both Google and AI. Reviews and reputation matter to both. Authoritative mentions matter to both. Fresh activity matters to both. One strategy, two discovery channels. Get your presence right, and you're visible everywhere.

slides.title: Your Local SEO Checklist

content.headline: Priority Actions for Local SEO Today

checklist.action: Claim and complete Google Business Profile

slides.narration: Here's your priority checklist for local SEO today. One: Claim and complete your Google Business Profile if you haven't. Two: Get listed in authoritative directories—real ones, not spam. Three: Build review velocity—ask every customer. Four: Ensure your name, address, phone is consistent everywhere. Five: Post regularly—events, updates, content. Six: Pursue local news mentions when you can. Do these six things and you're ahead of ninety percent of local businesses.

slides.title: Optimize Your Local SEO
slides.narration: Ready to get found locally? Download the complete SEO checklist—printable, actionable, everything you need. Or run a free SEO audit to see where you stand right now. Local SEO evolved, but it didn't die. The businesses that adapt are the ones getting found.

email_1_educational.subject: Local SEO isn't dead—it evolved. Here's what works now.
email_1_educational.preview_text: The new rules of getting found
email_1_educational.body:
Hey {{first_name}},

You've probably heard: 'SEO is dead.'

Here's the truth: Local SEO evolved. What works now is different.

Old rules (don't work):
❌ Keyword stuffing
❌ Link schemes
❌ Gaming the algorithm

New rules (do work):
✓ Multi-platform presence
✓ Real reputation signals
✓ Entity-based optimization
✓ Activity across channels

[WATCH THE 3-MINUTE GUIDE →]

Bonus: The same strategy that helps Google also helps AI assistants recommend you.

{{sender_name}}
Fibonacco
